newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Interbrew to take 50.8% of Ukraine brewer.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Interbrew to take 50.8% of Ukraine brewer.

text.p: Privately-owned Belgian brewer Interbrew has agreed to buy a majority stake in Ukranian brewer Chernigiv Brewery - Desna, Interbrew said in a statement on Monday.
It gave no financial details of the deal. Interbrew would take a 50.8 percent stake in the share capital of Desna through a capital increase.
Interbrew said this was the first strategic alliance between a Ukrainian brewer and an international player.
The statement said Desna was a strong regional brewer whose main brand was Chernigiv.
Located in Chernigiv itself, about 150 kms north-east of Kiev, the brewery produced over 500,000 hectolitres of beer and soft drinks in 1995. It employs about 650 people.
"Interbrew has decided on this investment after a very thorough environmental study...which showed that both the barley and water were of high quality," the Belgian company said in the statement.
Best know for its Stella Artois brand, Interbrew is one of the world's leading brewing groups, and exports products to over 80 countries around the world.
